long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Remote Control for TV is a practical web extension for you to remote control your Roku smart TV from your Chrome over WiFi. When your TV and this web app are under the same WiFi network, you can control the TV from a browser.

Features of the TV remote extension app:
ðŸ‘‰Volume up/down, Mute on/off on your TV with this universal Roku TV remote.
ðŸ‘‰Channels up/down and select your favorite channels from list selection.
ðŸ‘‰Control playback of your content with Play/Pause/FastForward/Rewind buttons
ðŸ‘‰""Home"" button on the top of Roku remote extension app to return to the home menu with just one tap.
ðŸ‘‰Press ""Back"" button on the upper left side of this remote control to go back to the previous page.
ðŸ‘‰Tap ""OK"" to confirm your choice, just like operating on a real TV remote control.

How does this App work?
Step 1. Add this web app to your Chrome extension and launch it.
Step 2. On your Roku TV, go to Settings > Network > About to find the network IP address, the IP address information appears on the right side of the screen.
Step 3. Enter the IP address on the web app, then click "Connect". after connecting, you can control your TV now.

Note: To find the network IP address on Roku TV, you can refer to this guide: https://www.boostvision.tv/find-roku-ip-address-without-remote.html

Troubleshoot:
-This extension app can only connect if you are on the same IP address/WiFi as your Roku TV device.
-Re-adding this remote app and rebooting the smart TV will solve most of the connection issues.

NOTE: This Remote Control for TV extension app is not an official product of Roku, Inc.
